website_summaries.verdict: Weighing in at less than a pound, these carbon poles won't become burdensome on longer trips.
pros: Impossibly lightweight carbon construction, but can hold the weight of most slips and trips
Vented grips made with EVA foam and don't slip when you sweat
cons: Handle buttons seem more vulnerable to failure than other models

customer_reviews.title: One pole not functioning after a few months and I can't return.
customer_reviews.text: The button that enables the pole to collapse is stuck on one of the poles after a couple of months of use and can't be depressed unless brute force, like a hammer, is used. Amazon says the return window is closed so evidently the company doesn't stand by their products. Good to know. I won't be purchasing more products from Black Diamond again and will blast this info. so others are aware and don't spend major bucks with no way to exchange for products that function. Huge fail Black Diamond. And Amazon for not supporting your Prime members.
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Great ultralight poles!
customer_reviews.text: These poles are easy to use lightweight and comfortable. I used them in the 2018 Never Summer 100k which had 13,000 feet of climbing including several mountain summits. These poles worked like a champ! On the rugged sections they were sturdy and took my weight when I stumbled with no problems. On the runable sections they are so light that holding them in hand is no burden at all.
customer_reviews.author: Waylon Wade

customer_reviews.title: Drop in quality from previous version.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the straps began to fray in my first venture out with these. My old aluminum pair made the entire John Muir trail with me with nothing but scratches and a bend from saving my life (nearly fell off Whitney). These new carbon poles are super lightweight which is great but with both straps frayed after a single 11 mile hike up and down Mt Adams, I’ll be discussing with Black Diamond...
customer_reviews.author: Gearhed79

customer_reviews.title: Cracked carbon, terrible company
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. Company does not stand behind their product. I used these poles maybe six times total and one of them cracked around the circumference of the pole near the top. Because it's been more than a year Black Diamond will not cover them. I have a cheap aluminum pair that I use normally and save the carbon for races and big efforts. I've used their headlights in the past as well, but I will never buy another Black Diamond product again. Chinese junk. I'll go to Leki and Petzl.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Krott

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke on third hike
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the wrist strap broke on my third hike. I also found the pole sections to come apart sometimes while hiking. This would happen if the pole got stuck in rocks and you had to pull it out a little bit. (The sections wouldn't slide out completely, maybe just a quarter inch, but it was a bit annoying.) I general I think it's worth considering a pole that has adjustable height so you can have one height for going up in another height for going down. Hopefully Amazon or Black Diamond will take care of the broken strap for me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trail Running Poles
customer_reviews.text: I recently "ran" (lots of speed hiking involved) the Ultra Trail du Mont Blanc course (100+ miles, 30,000+ feet of gain) with the Black Diamond Distance Carbon Z. I was very impressed with how light and sturdy they were. I own Leki poles with the quick release system, but I much prefer the adjustable straps on the Carbon Z. Excellent grip and leverage for those steep ascents. I could not imagine running any mountain course without these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Jirn

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as you’d expect.
customer_reviews.text: Broke them on my first challenging hike. On the descent, I slipped and the tip of the pole was a bit lodged between rocks. They snapped like a dry bone. Have since purchased the aluminum version and have been much more happy. Summited Mount Rainier with aluminum version, with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: SKACH

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking poles. Just hiked about 6k elevation in Colorado and poles were great. Fold up for easy storage and packing in suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: RachelH

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact
customer_reviews.text: These were used for a Ultra marathon 31 miles. These poles stood up to the test. Very lightweight and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin May

customer_reviews.title: Choice... Mint.... love dem poles YO!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, buy now! Seriously though training for 38 mile T ride mountain race and long story longer these are a game changer! I’m 5’10” and I got the 120 cm and work well or on the downs and ups. Even in snow without the extra cup attachment.
customer_reviews.author: conrad truman

customer_reviews.title: 5'10" and perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: These trekking poles are very light and comfortable to use. The important thing to remember is the pull the handle out until it clicks.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: one of the best options out there for folding poles
customer_reviews.text: If you’re reading this you probably should just buy these. Leki is one of the only other brands with something comparable, but realistically these are the lightest folding poles you’ll find for a good price. I don’t love the foam grips, but the folding mechanism is great. Would be nice if they came in 5cm increments as I ended up sizing up, which I’ve found useful in the snow and for water crossings.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Started malfunctioning after a year
customer_reviews.text: These started out being great, light-weight poles, and I liked the collapsibility. However, when fully extended, a little knob at the top locks them into place. After a year, one of the knobs became incredibly difficult to push them back in. It was near impossible in cold conditions. Not worth the frustration and I think I'll go back to a different style where you can adjust the sizing as well. One size is OK but it's nice to be able to extend or retract them a bit to adjust when going uphill or downhill, especially on 10+ mile hikes in the Rockies.
customer_reviews.author: Lord of the Gnar

customer_reviews.title: Yosemite and Mt Whitney
customer_reviews.text: Took these poles up Half Dome, Lower and Upper Yosemite Falls, and Mariposa Grove in Yosemite. Also went up Mount Whitney with them. All within a week's timespan for around 50 miles of heavy hiking. The poles performed great. They were comfortable, sturdy, and held their ground over all sorts of terrain. Setup and breakdown is instant, they pack down small, and are very lightweight. Very happy and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheKolanders

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I hike all of the time and take lots of trips. These sticks will fold up in your luggage and are super strong.
customer_reviews.author: JosephJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: A big step up in quality and lightweight compared to the cheap poles I owned
customer_reviews.author: Rick P.

customer_reviews.title: broken pole
customer_reviews.text: One pole broke 3 days into a 3 week hike. Would never buy a black diamond pole again. now I have to engage with Amazon and the manufacturer to get my money back. Thank God for credit card companies.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cluck

customer_reviews.title: So light
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly light, but unbelievably sturdy. Also can be folded small enough to be packed inside a small backpack. So impressed that I bought a second one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: josephine Sonu

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far these have been great, I ran Free State 100k and used them due to it being a rocky, technical course, with decent elev gain (6500' over the whole course). These held up great and I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Landrum

customer_reviews.title: Great for long distance trail races
customer_reviews.text: Light and sturdy Straps too stiff maybe with more use become more pliable Used it for a 77 k ultramarathon 24hr race will use them again I’m getting the flex tip protectors this friday
customer_reviews.author: daniel puentes

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this and used it on my recent hike. I find these absolutely amazing. They are super light weight and pretty strong. I will advise to get a pair of rubber tips along with it, at least I did and found useful. You wont go wrong with these carbon fiber frames.
customer_reviews.author: verified customer

customer_reviews.title: Best there is
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best there is. I’ve used in several long backpacking trips and they are great sturdy and lightweight. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mellissa Westbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Super lite and sturdy poles for ultra runs!
customer_reviews.text: Used for 100 mile run in the Franklin Mountains and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

customer_reviews.title: High quality material
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried them on the trail yet but I can tell the high quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Arroyave

customer_reviews.title: Great trekking poles
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, not feel like very sturdy but actually it is.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Easy to fold up and attach to backpack when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: My black diamond carbon z cracked...
customer_reviews.text: I used my stick black diamond last week e saw had a problem. Just in one stick cracked. I believe these are made carbon. Whats happen? I live in Brasil and need you send me other stick, because this certainly was with problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Anibal Pizzinatto

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: Super light and pack into suitcase or side pocket of day pack really easily.
customer_reviews.author: Una Kim

customer_reviews.title: Poles broke for no apparent reason during use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these poles in September 2019, I hike 5 miles daily and do search and rescue. Today on my regular hike one of the poles just bent for no apparent reason and is no longer usable. Very disappointing for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C.

customer_reviews.title: Greay for trail running and extreme backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put hundreds of miles on the poles and haven’t had any issues- they are so lightweight yet durable!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Running Poles
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight poles for UTA saved me so many times on so many hills
customer_reviews.author: Kazzle

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have only used them once but they packed easily and weigh almost nothing
customer_reviews.author: Linda Forrestel

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: After a significant amount of research, I chose to purchase these poles and have no regrets. I have used them through the summer and the fall with no complaints but do plan to purchase another set for the cold winter months here in NY as I am not sure these would withstand the deep snow and ice.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyJane

customer_reviews.title: Best poles I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are without a doubt the best poles I've ever owned. Prior to this I owned two different pair of telescoping poles and on both of those the clamps failed much faster than expected. On one set of REI brand telescoping poles (that cost more than these), the clamps failed in less than 48 hours. These things have handled years of abuse with no problems at all. And they fit in your luggage. (Solid single-piece poles are even nicer, but I can't bring them on a plane).
customer_reviews.author: 808person

customer_reviews.title: Lousy poles
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought they were great. Super light weight and fairly sturdy. But after three hikes they won’t stay connected. Every step they just flop apart. Not only annoying, but the first couple of times I almost face planted. I have other BD stuff and it’s good, but not these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gore

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HIKING POLES
customer_reviews.text: THE POLES ARE VERY STURDY, VERY LIGHT WEIGHT AND COLLAPSE EASILY. FITS EASILY INTO MY BACKPACK WHEN NOT NEEDED. I WAS FINE WITH THE FIXED LENGTH. ONCE YOU DETERMINE WHAT IS CORRECT LENGTH FOR YOU, THE NEED TO CHANGE MUCH BEYOND THE LOWER HAND GRIP IS RARE. I WOULD DEFINITEY RECMOMEND.
customer_reviews.author: james sakamoto

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight trekking poles. Convenient for transportation. But they don't look very strong. I would take other poles for a hike in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Fedin

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Distance Carbon Z Trekking Poles
product_meta.description: Black Diamondƒ_Ts Distance Carbon Z is our lightest Z-Pole engineered for those who travel fast. With 100% carbon construction, the Distance Carbon Z weighs just 9 ounces and features a three-section foldable design that allows for fast-response deployment. Weƒ_Tve improved the Distance Carbon Zƒ_Ts joint support, making them 30% stiffer, and theyƒ_Tre now more durable with reinforcements around the locking mechanism and upper shaft. Non-scarring rubber Tech Tips and a lightweight, EVA foam grip round out this pole as a lightweight detail-driven pillar in trekking pole tech.
feature_bullets: Three-section foldable design with speed-cone deployment
More durable with added aluminum ring to protect carbon
